page.title: 11MR VERNEY
page.content: Mr. Verney has been a tailor in{ {Elham}for 74 years, since 1911.He was apprenticed for 5 years and paid one shilling per week. He made hunting coats, riding breeches, livery for coachmen, footmen and gamekeepers; {Acrise}and{Sandling}Place being his clients. He even had clients from {America, France and Sweden. { }The scissors that he cut the material with, were over 100 year old. The materials that he used were strong broad cloth, cavalry twill and cordouroy. They were mostly hand stitched. Two people who lived in{ {London}made the family crest buttons for the uniforms. When these two people died other people tried to make the buttons but the tops kept falling off.
